label: logicB:ecology_en
steps: [1] If apex predators are removed from the ecosystem, herbivore populations increase.
[2] If herbivore populations increase, grazing pressure on palatable plants becomes high.
[3] For any plant species x, if x is highly palatable to these herbivores, then x faces higher grazing risk.
[4] If grazing pressure is high and species a faces higher grazing risk, then species a declines in abundance.
[5] Apex predators were removed from the ecosystem.
[6] Species a is highly palatable to these herbivores.
[7] Grazing pressure is high and species a faces higher grazing risk (from [1â€“3], [5], [6]).
[8] Species a declines in abundance (from [4] and [7]).
